fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend
Class Solution

java.lang.Object
  fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.Solution
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
public final class Solution
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>

Central class of the library. The solution is a set of reactives and ReactionRules. A reactive can be any kind of object or primitive type. It can also be an other Solution. The ReactionRules are objects that implements the interface ReactiveRule.

Author:
Andréolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur
See Also:
ReactionRule

Field Detail

_mapElements

private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> _mapElements
The map containing all the reactives. The keys of the map are the type (i.e java.lang.String) and the values are a list of object containing all the reactives of this type.

_mapReactionRulesSetters

private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> _mapReactionRulesSetters
The map that remembers all the reaction rules setters so that we have to search for them only once. The keys are the concatenation of the class name and the attribute name, and the values are the name of the setter method. This table is constructed in the add function.

_inert

private boolean _inert
Indicates whether or not the solution is inert. An inert solution is a solution that finished all its possible reaction and reached a stable state.

_reactionInProgress

private boolean _reactionInProgress
Indicates that the reaction is still in progress. Useful for the reaction rules threads. If it is set at false, all the thread stop. Difference with _inert is that _inert is used for the user, and _reactionInProgress is used internally and is not always synchronized with _inert.

_threadTable

private java.util.Map<ReactionRule,ChemicalThread> _threadTable
The list containing all the threads of the solution's reactions rules threads (each reaction rule has its own thread).

_threadGroup

private java.lang.ThreadGroup _threadGroup
The thread group, common to all the threads

_strategy

private Solution.Strategy _strategy
The reactive iteration strategy, chosen by the user. The chosen strategy will apply to every reaction rule added in this solution.

See Also:
Solution.Strategy

_listener

private InertEventListener _listener
The inert event listener of this solution. Might be an other solution or a listener defined by the user. ONly one inert listener can be used a a time.

See Also:
InertEvent, InertEventListener
Constructor Detail

Solution

public Solution()
Default constructor for a Chemical Programming-powered Solution.
Uses random strategy as default behavior

Solution.Strategy

Method Detail

checkReactionRuleReactive

private boolean checkReactionRuleReactive(java.lang.Object reactionRuleObject)
Used in add function when a ReactionRule object is added as a reactive. Checks if the ReactionRule class is valid.
A valid ReactionRule class implements setters for its attributes that do not specify the Dontreact annotation.

Parameters:
reactionRuleObject - The reaction rule object added in the solution.
Returns:
true if the reaction rule object is valid
See Also:
Dontreact, ReactionRule

processAddSubSolution

private void processAddSubSolution(java.lang.Object solutionObject)
Used in add function to add a sub-solution as a reactive in the solution.
Applies a special treatment to the solution reactive : sets a InertEventListener on the sub-solution, and begin the reaction of the sub-solution.

Parameters:
solutionObject - The sub-solution added.
See Also:
InertEventListener

add

public boolean add(java.lang.Object newReactive)
Adds any type of object to this solution.
Every object inserted in the solution will be considered as a reactive, included Solution objects and ReactionRule objects, and can be used by any ReactionRule object.

Specified by:
add in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
newReactive - The new reactive to add to the solution.
Returns:
true (as specified by Collection.add(E))

Collection.add(java.lang.Object)

deleteReaction

void deleteReaction(ReactionRule r)
Deletes the specified reaction rule from this solution. If this solution does not contain the specified reaction rule, nothing is done. Else, the thread associated to the reaction rule is also stopped. In case the reaction rule removed is the last one in this solution, the end of the reaction is detected.

Parameters:
r - The reaction rule to be removed from this solution.
See Also:
ReactionRule, endOfReaction()

checkTrivialEndOfReaction

private void checkTrivialEndOfReaction()
Checks if the end of the reaction is reached. The end of the reaction is reached when there is no longer any active thread and that there is no non inert inner solution. In the contrary, if the end of the reaction isn't reached, this function wakes all the reaction rule threads.

endOfReaction

private void endOfReaction()
Ends and stops the reaction. The _inert and _reactionInProgress booleans are switched, and the InertEvent is fired.

See Also:
_inert, _reactionInProgress, InertEvent, InertEventListener

fireInertEvent

public void fireInertEvent(InertEvent e)
Fires the inert event notifying this solution's inert event listeners that this solution is now inert.

Parameters:
e - The inert event to be fired.
See Also:
InertEvent, InertEventListener

get_reactionInProgress

boolean get_reactionInProgress()
Returns true if this solution is still reacting (similar to ! _inert).

Returns:
true if the reaction is in progress.

getNumberOfActiveThreads

private int getNumberOfActiveThreads()
Gives the number of thread that are awaken in this solution. Each thread corresponds to a reaction rule.

Returns:
The number of active threads of this solution.

ChemicalThread

containsNonInertSubSol

private boolean containsNonInertSubSol()
Returns true if this solution contains at least one non inert inner solution.

Returns:
true if this solution contains at least one non inert inner solution.

getReactiveType

private java.lang.String getReactiveType(java.lang.Object reactive)
Gives the type of the specified reactive. For most of the object, the value returned is it's raw name (object.getClass().getName()), but for the Solution and ReactionRule object, a special name is returned.

Parameters:
reactive - Object whose type is to be determined.
Returns:
The java type of the specified reactive.

is_inert

public boolean is_inert()
Returns true if this solution is inert. A Solution is inert when no more reaction are possible. This means that there is no more ReactionRules that can react; the solution reached a stable state. Note: to be inert, all the solution's inner solutions must be inert as well.

Returns:
true if this solution is inert.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Returns true if this solution contains no elements/reactives.

Specified by:
isEmpty in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
Returns:
true if this solution contains no elements/reactives.

iterator

public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> iterator()
Returns an iterator over the elements/reactives in this solution. As this solution can contain any type of element, the function returns an iterator of Object objects. There are no guarantees concerning the order in which the elements are returned

Specified by:
iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>
Specified by:
iterator in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
Returns:
an Iterator over the elements in this solution.
See Also:
Iterator

makeSleep

void makeSleep()
Called by a thread, makes the thread wait until a notify is called. When a reaction rule did not find any reactives, it calls this function that will "make" it sleep. It checks if this reaction rule's thread is the last standing. If it is, it stops all the reaction and declares the solution inert. This function is called by the main function of a chemical thread.

See Also:
ChemicalThread, _inert

react

public void react()
Launches the reaction of this solution. This is the main function that begins the reaction of the solution. After that, the reaction does not stop until the function is_inert returns true or until an InertEvent is fired.
This function begins by launching the reactions in this solution's inner solutions and declares itself as non inert. All the threads of the reaction rules from this solutions and its inner solutions are started all together. In case this solution does not contain any inner solution nor reaction rule, nothing happens.

remove

public boolean remove(java.lang.Object reactive)
Removes a single instance of the specified element/reactive from this solution, if it is present. Returns true if this solution contained the specified element/reactive (or equivalently, if this solution changed as a result of the call).

Specified by:
remove in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
reactive - Element to be removed from this solution, if present.
Returns:
true if an element was removed as a result of this call

removeAll

public boolean removeAll(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Object> c)
Removes all of this solution's elements that are also contained in the specified collection.

Specified by:
removeAll in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
c - Collection containing elements to be removed from this solution.
Returns:
true if this solution changed as a result of the call.

requestForParameters

boolean requestForParameters(ReactionRule r)
Called by every thread-reaction rule to get its reactives. It returns true if a set of parameter has been found, else false. The reactives are set directly in the reaction rule instance by reflexivity, there is no need to return them. This function is synchronized on the _mapElements attribute.

Parameters:
r - The reaction rule requesting for parameters;
Returns:
true if parameters/reactives where found.
See Also:
ReactionRule, _mapElements

searchForReactives

private java.util.List<Pair<Solution,java.lang.Object>> searchForReactives(ReactionRule rr,
                                                                           java.lang.reflect.Field[] rrFields,
                                                                           IndexProvider indexProvider)
                                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Searches for reactives for the specified reaction rule. The difference with requestForParameters(ReactionRule) is that this functions is given a fully instanciated index provider. If a set of reactives is found following the types, the ReactionRule.computeSelect() is tested. In case of success, the reaction rule's fields are instantiated. Returns the set of reactives one was found that passes the ReactionRule.computeSelect() function. If no valid set of reactives was found, returns null.

Parameters:
rr - The reaction rule asking for reactives
rrFields - The fields of the reaction rule
indexProvider - The index provider,
Returns:
The set of reactives if a valid one was found, else null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
See Also:
IndexProvider

extractReactivesFromSolutions

private void extractReactivesFromSolutions(java.util.List<Pair<Solution,java.lang.Object>> reactives)
Extracts the given reactives from this solution (and inner solutions). This function is called right after finding reactives for a reaction rule that matches the types and the ReactionRule.computeSelect(). They have to be deleted from this solution, just like chemical reactives in real chemistry. reactives can possibly be in a non inert inner solution (using sch a reactive is not allowed by chemical programming).

Parameters:
reactives - The list of reactives to be deleted. Reactives can possibly be in inner solutions.

instanciateField

private Pair<Solution,java.lang.Object> instanciateField(java.lang.reflect.Field f,
                                                         SubIndexProvider sip,
                                                         ReactionRule r)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                         java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
This function is used to instantiate a field of a reaction rule in order to perform a reaction. When a set of reactives matching the right types for the specified reaction rule are found, this function is called (by searchForReactives(ReactionRule, Field[], IndexProvider) to instantiate the reaction rule's fields one by one. To succeed this operation needs to use an SubIndexProvider which gives the index of the element/reactive to use in this solution or in its inner solutions.

Parameters:
f - The ReactionRule field
sip - The sub index provider
r - The reaction rule that is concerned by the instanciation.
Returns:
A pair of object containing the value to be set to the field, and a reference to the solution ('possibly an inner solution) in which this reactive is contained.
Throws:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

retainAll

public boolean retainAll(java.util.Collection<?> c)
Retains only the elements/reactives in this solution that are contained in the specified collection. In other words, removes from this solution all of its elements that are not contained in the specified collection.

Specified by:
retainAll in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
c - Collection containing elements to be retained in this solution.
Returns:
true if this collection changed as a result of the call.

Returns:
An array containing all of the elements in this solution in any order.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this solution. The string representation consists of a list of the elements indexed by their type. Here is an example:
Solution is:
java.lang.String -> [string1, string2, string3]
java.lang.Integer -> [int1, int2, int3, int4, int5]

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

wakeAll

public void wakeAll()
Notifies all the threads waiting on this solution's instance. This function is called by a reaction rule's thread when it successfully reacted, to wake every thread that was waiting.

getSubSolutions

java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getSubSolutions()
Returns a list containing all the innner solutions of this solution

Returns:
A list containing all the innner solutions of this solution

getMapElements

Returns:
The map of elements containing all this solution's elements/reactives.

setLogFile

public static void setLogFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Sets the log file of the chemical library. For information, logs are set not to be bigger than 10,000 bytes long and rotate over 5 files Anyhow, System.err is default log output stream whether this method is called or not

Parameters:
fileName - File name of the log file (a number from 0 to 4 will be appended during logs rotation)
Throws:
java.io.IOException
